subject: Re: [junit] Global variable?
msgSnippet: ... Unless something has changed while I wasn t looking, that is not true at all. Each test executes as a separate instance of TestCase, which explains why
messageBody:
Kevin Duffey wrote:

> JUnit loads each TestCase in it's own classloader.

Unless something has changed while I wasn't looking, that is not true at
all.

Each test executes as a separate instance of TestCase, which explains
why writing to an instance variable from one test will not affect the
value read by another test. This is why data shared between tests needs
to be class-level, or global.
